content.body: http://intertwingly.net/blog/2004/10/20/Attractive-Nuisance#c1239547517 - the line between markup and text seems to get ignored quite frequently
Any of the authors to html4.01 in here?
we got a discussions about the semantic meaning of <hr> and <center> and why center is deprecated but hr isn't anyone happen to know the actual reason?

I remember reading this in the HTML5 specs, but I can't seem to find the exact link again... Is it okay to use vertical pipe characters to separate navigation list items, f.e.

Bla | Foo | Bar
Any hints on where this is defined in the spec? ;)
jcranmer, the character you just typed isn't ·
huh, must be because the text is bold at the same time
MathiasBynens: paragraphs can contain anything they want, text-wise
MathiasBynens: i don't think the spec says what text is ok, it's just assumed that, well, anything the spec doesn't disallow is allowed
